definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: Ice-breaker assistance resumed at 0800 local time.
sentences.chinese: 破冰援助在當地時間0800時恢復。

sentences.english: The atomic icebreaker reeved the icebergs.
sentences.chinese: 原子破冰船穿過冰山之間向前航行。

sentences.english: Ever had a carload of girls drive by when you're jogging and scream at you approvingly ?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有女人對你笑然後主動破冰接近你？

sentences.english: The country is gently being released from the diplomatic deep-freeze.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家正在緩緩走向外交的破冰之旅。

sentences.english: Icebreaker ‘Krasin’ is a museum that could be visited during the Festival of Modern art held in a traditional museum.
sentences.chinese: 人們可以在現代藝術節期間參觀破冰船“卡拉辛”號。

sentences.english: I heard that the government sends some icebreakers to settle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說是政府派遣破冰船來解決問題。

sentences.english: I will protect you and break open the crowds in your way like an ice-breaker in arctic sea.
sentences.chinese: 我要護著妳，撥開擋路的人羣如破冰船行在北極冰洋。

sentences.english: I think we just hit the tip of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得這只是剛剛開始的破冰之旅。

sentences.english: I start to draw my bow into stern notch of ice-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 把我船頭拉入破冰船船尾凹部。

sentences.english: Smaller ships break the ice to open up passage ways.
sentences.chinese: 小一些的船破冰開道路。

sentences.english: This means that long-awaited low-altitude airspace to the open ice.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着市場期待已久的開放低空空域得以破冰。

sentences.english: Increased the Fire damage inflicted by the Icebreaker weapon enchantment.
sentences.chinese: 增加了破冰者武器附魔造成的火焰傷害。

sentences.english: Ice-breaker assistance suspended until favourable weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 在比較適意氣候條件來到前破冰援助暫停。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
to freeze over (of water or land)
to go out to sea/(neologism) to expand into overseas markets
downstream/to go into the water/to put into water/to launch (a ship)/fig. to fall into bad ways/to lead astray/to go to pot
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 啟航|启航[qi3 hang2]
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
the North Pole/the Arctic Pole/the north magnetic pole
